item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:17, topic:306066”][quote author=.Unlimited link=topic=402247.msg2987013#msg2987013 date=1255049538]

I’m so sad, those fags at nintendo deleted my homebrew

never heard of that happening - are you the only one in the world?

Actually the wiimenu 4.2 update deletes homebrew channel if you have it installed.
http://forum.wiibrew.org/read.php?21,35547,page=1
[/quote]

haha, crazy shit, thats like the day after i softmodded my wii (and read all the articles saying theres never been an update that deleted homebrew etc)

i stand corrected[/quote]

It was 2 days after I installed it on my brothers wii too, crazy stuff.

What is the game?

If I were you I would install the homebrew channel, get a backup loader and if you can’t make a backup from that copy you can download one (legally, since you own the game) and play it that way.
[/quote]

I’m so sad, those fags at nintendo deleted my homebrew :([/quote]
That is why you don’t leave connect24 on. And don’t update unless you check homebrew and see that its safe.

item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

If you have a blockbuster with a gamestation/blockbuster games section then you can give them your disc and they’ll put a new unscratched layer on it which fills in the gaps and makes it all nice and shiny. Costs like 1 quid.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

What is the game?

If I were you I would install the homebrew channel, get a backup loader and if you can’t make a backup from that copy you can download one (legally, since you own the game) and play it that way.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

Toothpaste worked well enough for me to copy an entire disc on to my computer which had EXTREMELY deep scratches. However, after the copy, I could never get the disc to work again.

If they aren’t too deep, you could try getting them buffed out at a game or video store. Also, scratch removers never worked for me (scratched up Ratchet and Clank: Up your Arsenal ftl)…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @933pm 933pm
item.description:
@933pm wrote:

Just make sure the toothpaste you’re using is the kind WITHOUT the little crystal things in it.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“Davidude, post:6, topic:306066”]Shaving cream? Haven’t heard that one before.

Just for the record I tried toothpaste and it didn’t have any effect, however I have heard a lot of people say toothpaste.[/quote]
Yeah it works. My friend showed me it on his ps2, his disc wouldn’t work (as in would crash) so then he rubbed with shaving cream and washed it off with water then it worked.

Been working for me ever since.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:1, topic:306066"]Well, I’ve had this game for like 2 years, but I recently moved so I haven’t played it in a long time, or even played my Wii.
So randomly I was like “Why not play my favorite game?..”, but my sister put it in a gamecube game case and it’s very badly scratched.
I’ve google’d everything but it still returns “Cannot load game disc data” Or something like that.
There’s a v2 out now, for like $19.00 now which I don’t mind spending, but I still want to have the old game back.
Don’t flame me for using the Wii, I know Xbox is a lot better, but I don’t want to spend so much money for it.
Any tips on completely removing the scratches? Or is it too severely scratched.[/quote]
Go to a local gamestop and buy a scratch remover.

Read full topic
